{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Evaluating the Effects of a Large-Scale Asset Transfer and Training Programme in Rural Bangladesh",
    "matches_expected_title": "NO"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "BRAC Ultra-Poor Programme",
    "country": "Bangladesh",
    "region": null,
    "target_population": "Poorest women in rural Bangladesh"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "stipend",
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": "forty weeks",
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "The targeted women receive business assets (mostly livestock and poultry), business training, a stipend for a forty week period, health and legal advice."
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["livestock", "poultry"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "The targeted women receive business assets (mostly livestock and poultry), business training, a stipend for a forty week period, health and legal advice."
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "wealth levels",
      "occupational structure",
      "household durables",
      "business skills",
      "health status",
      "social networks",
      "savings",
      "consumption",
      "children's z-scores",
      "BMI"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "We find that beneficiaries' wealth levels and occupational structure converge to that of lower-middle class households. Beneficiaries use their newly found wealth to purchase household durables, and improve their human capital, as measured by business skills and their health status. | The programme has the intended effect on direct beneficiary ultra-poor households. Namely treated households still have the assets one year after the transfer, and their savings have increased as dictated by the programme. | Our measure of business skills increases by 20%, and beneficiaries' BMI increases by 6%. Similarly, children's z-scores increase by .72."
    ,
    "study_design": "Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "We use a randomized control trial research design, and survey all households in the community. | The effect of the programme is identified as the difference in difference before and after the programme in treated and control communities.",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": null,
    "sample_size": null,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,
    "qualitative_methods": [],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": false,
    "cost_mentions": null,
    "cost_evidence_citation": null
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "The BRAC ultra-poor programme is now being copied and exported to a wide range of settings across the globe.",
    "country_citation": "We provide evidence on this issue by looking at the effects of a large-scale asset transfer and training programme which is targeted at the poorest women in rural Bangladesh.",
    "target_population_citation": "The programme aims to empower the poorest women in Bangladesh economically, socially and psychologically, through a multi-faceted intervention."
  }
}
